page.title: 01General Review
page.content: {This is primarily an agricultural {landscape lying to the North of the {market town of Wellington (Shropshire) {which is itself the northern part of {Telford New Town. {The land is flat, and lies at {approximately 60 metres above sea {level. It is crossed by the River {Tern, itself a tributary of the River {Severn. {Settlement in the area consists of one {village, Waters Upton, and, in the {south-west of the block, part of the {village of Crudgington. There is the {samall hamlet of Rowton in the {north-west of the area, and a large {number of dispersed farms. {There is very little industry except {the creamery at Crudgington. The {main A442 road runs N/S through the {eastern part of the block. }
